explanation: Steep slopes with very high rainfall cause severe runoff and soil loss. Bench terracing reduces slope length and controls erosion.
Moderate slopes with high rainfall benefit from contour bunds that slow runoff and increase water infiltration.
Gentle slopes can be protected by farming along contour lines to reduce runoff velocity.
Flat lands experience low erosion risk; organic cover helps protect topsoil and retain moisture.
Sandy soils are highly erodible; vegetative barriers help stabilize soil and reduce wind and water erosion.
Very high erosion risk areas require a combination of structural and vegetative measures at watershed level.
